intro: Cynoglossum krasniqii, commonly known as the Balkan mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves and small, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to poor, well-drained soils. Cynoglossum krasniqii is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
